entries.title: Myanmar soldiers cut off tattoos and gave detainees urine to drink, witnesses tell BBC
entries.description: Witnesses tell the BBC the Myanmar army tortured and killed dozens of men in a village in Rakhine State.

entries.title: Israeli strike on UN school in Gaza reportedly kills at least 35
entries.description: The Israeli military said it struck a "Hamas compound" in the school - a claim Hamas officials deny.

entries.title: Biden draws links with WW2 and Ukraine in D-Day address
entries.description: Joe Biden says democracies are under threat, adding autocrats were "watching happens in Ukraine".

entries.title: At least 150 villagers feared dead in Sudan massacre
entries.description: Social media footage shows dozens of bodies wrapped in shrouds prepared for burial in Gezira state.

entries.title: Hiker finds pipe feeding China's tallest waterfall
entries.description: A hiker posted a  video showing the water flow of the fall was coming from a pipe built into the rock face.

entries.title: Russia holds Frenchman accused of military spying
entries.description: Moscow says the man was gathering military data about Russia and failed to register as a "foreign agent".

entries.title: India’s opposition looked down and out – now they’re back
entries.description: Narendra Modi has won - but the election is being seen as a huge comeback for his opponents.

entries.title: Putin warns Russia could provide weapons to strike West
entries.description: The Russian president has been criticising the West's delivery of long-range weapons to Ukraine.

entries.title: New York moves to revoke Trump's gun licence - reports
entries.description: The former president will be banned from owning a firearm as a convicted criminal, US media says.

entries.title: WW2 veteran aged 102 dies on way to D-Day event
entries.description: Robert "Al" Persichitti, who served with the Navy in Japan, became ill on his way to Normandy.

entries.title: Colombian government sets peace talks date with rebels
entries.description: Formal peace talks between the Second Marquetalia and the government will start on 25 June.

entries.title: Djokovic 'will do best to return soon' after knee surgery
entries.description: Novak Djokovic says he will do his best to return to the court "as soon as possible" after undergoing surgery on a knee injury.

entries.title: ‘Cold lava’ floods Philippines village after eruption
entries.description: Footage shows rivers of volcanic ash and debris following an ‘explosive eruption’ at Mt Kanlaon.

entries.title: Man arrested in Qatar Grindr 'sting' sentenced
entries.description: Manuel Guerrero Aviña was arrested in February after arranging to meet a man on a gay dating app.

entries.title: French police arrest Russian-Ukrainian man on bomb-making charges
entries.description: A man is under investigation after being badly burned in an explosion in his hotel room near Paris.

entries.title: Boeing launches long-delayed astronaut capsule
entries.description: US astronauts ride a new crew capsule to orbit after a long and tortuous development programme.

entries.title: Slovak PM blames shooting on opposition's 'hatred'
entries.description: Robert Fico describes man who shot him as an "opposition activist" and blames "anti-government media".

entries.title: UN nuclear watchdog urges Iran to cooperate
entries.description: The UN's nuclear watchdog votes to censure Iran for failing to cooperate fully with  the agency.

entries.title: Watch: Moving and spectacular D-Day commemorations
entries.description: Watch: Moving and spectacular D-Day commemorations

entries.title: Watch: Space X Starship makes successful splashdown
entries.description: The rocket made it much further in its planned mission profile than on previous tests, splashing down in the Indian Ocean.

entries.title: ‘Cold lava’ floods Philippines village after eruption
entries.description: Footage shows rivers of volcanic ash and debris following an ‘explosive eruption’ at Mt Kanlaon.

entries.title: What worked for India's Modi - and what didn’t?
entries.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his party have won the most seats in this year's election.

entries.title: Arrests, accusations and AI: India’s election unpacked
entries.description: On 4 June, Indians will find out who governs their country for the next five years.

entries.title: RAF flypast for D-Day veterans on ferry to France
entries.description: The veterans are sailing to France from the UK to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the Normandy landings.

entries.title: First images of Hawaii's Kilauea volcano erupting
entries.description: Helicopter overflight of Hawaii's Kilauea volcano after eruption.

entries.title: Video shows air rescue after man falls from cliff in LA
entries.description: Firefighters airlifted the man to hospital after he fell nearly 30ft (9m) from a seaside cliff on Sunday.

entries.title: Son's funny faces overshadow lawmaker's House speech
entries.description: Representative John Rose was denouncing Donald Trump's guilty conviction as his son sat behind him.

entries.title: Americans react to Trump's guilty conviction
entries.description: The ex-president was found guilty on all counts of falsifying business records. Americans have mixed opinions about the verdict.

entries.title: Trump would run for president from jail, his lawyer says
entries.description: Alina Habba says Donald Trump will run for office even if he is jailed and "nothing will change" following his conviction for falsifying business records.

entries.title: ‘Aposiopesis’: Watch 12-year-old win US Spelling Bee
entries.description: Bruhat Soma correctly spelled words like ‘caixinha’ and ‘sciniph’ to take home the $50,000 prize.

entries.title: Mesmerising lava rivers as Icelandic volcano erupts
entries.description: Lava continues to spurt from from a volcanic system in Reykjanes Peninsula, after Wednesday's powerful eruption.

entries.title: District Attorney on Trump verdict: ‘I did my job’
entries.description: Alvin Bragg thanked the jury and prosecutors for their work "following the facts and the law". He said his team at the Manhattan District Attorney’s office had treated this case like they would any other, despite the defendant - a former president...

entries.title: Rapid displacement of Gazans 'having deadly effect'
entries.description: Children are "dying due to malnutrition and dehydration", an Unrwa spokesperson tells BBC Arabic.

entries.title: 'They gave us our freedom' - Veterans celebrated in Normandy
entries.description: Colourful events are taking place to commemorate D-Day, but the ongoing conflict in Ukraine casts a shadow of war over Europe.

entries.title: Russia's economy is growing, but can it last?
entries.description: Russia’s economy has been cut off from the global financial system - but it is still growing. Why?

entries.title: Europe’s centre left struggles to hold back surge from right
entries.description: Why parties on the left are heading for a lacklustre performance in European elections.

entries.title: Endometriosis tormented her every month - and killed her aged 38
entries.description: Jahmby Koikai spent most of her 38 years campaigning for better health care for women and girls.

entries.title: Israelis using gardening tools to fight wildfires sparked by Hezbollah rockets
entries.description: Residents of areas on the Israel-Lebanon border tell the BBC they "feel like the forgotten people".

entries.title: How Japan's biggest brewer aims to attract sober Gen Z
entries.description: Atsushi Katsuki tells the BBC the firm sees the sober generation as both a risk and an opportunity.
